text: the bread is top notch as well
i have to say they have one of the fastest delivery times in the city
food is always fresh and hot ready to eat
did i mention that the coffee is outstanding
certainly not the best sushi in new york however it is always fresh and the place is very clean sterile
i trust the people at go sushi it never disappoints
straightforward no surprises very decent japanese food
best spicy tuna roll great asian salad
try the rose roll not on menu
i love the drinks esp lychee martini and the food is also very good
in fact this was not a nicoise salad and was barely eatable

our waiter was horrible so rude and disinterested
the sangrias  watered down
menu  uneventful small

great food but the service was dreadful
the portions of the food that came out were mediocre
the two waitresss looked like they had been sucking on lemons
from the beginning we were met by friendly staff memebers and the convienent parking at chelsea piers made it easy for us to get to the boat
we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly and will be going back for the desserts
desserts are almost incredible my personal favorite is their tart of the day
i am surprised at the lower reviews because it is definitely better than other places i have tried with higher ratings
maybe the secret was that we went on a sunday night and everything was great
the food was extremely tasty creatively presented and the wine excellent
we ended up in little italy in late afternoon
we were pleasantly surprised with our choice
the lasagna was probably the best i have tasted

if youre craving some serious indian food and desire a cozy ambiance this is quite and exquisite choice
i definitely enjoyed the food as well
have always had a great time here

you will be very happy with the experience
the food is surprisingly good and the decor is nice

two wasted steaks  what a crime
the staff should be a bit more friendly
i absolutely suggest this place
i think the meatball parm is good

also the staff is very attentive and really personable
overall this is a great new restaurant that has been consistently good every time i have been
the gnocchi literally melts in your mouth
had a great experience at trio  staff was pleasant food was tasty and large in portion size  i would highly recommend the portobellogorgonzolasausage appetizer and the lobster risotto
entrees include classics like lasagna fettuccine alfredo and chicken parmigiana
the food is good the teriyaki i recommend
meal was very expensive for what you get

good food at the right price what more can you ask for
we love it and took buses and cabs to get there
if you re in new york you do not want to miss this place

great food great waitstaff great atmosphere and best of all great beer
this is still one of my most favorite restaurants in the area the food is inexpensive but very good kimono shrimp special was excellent and has a great atmosphere

however it was worth the visit

the food was delicious and clearly fresh ingredients were used
this made it obvious that the food wasnt cooked fresh it was obviously made before hand and then reheated
appetizer are excellent here you can make a great and inexpensive meal out of them
the spicy mussels are a highlight
also get the onion rings  best weve ever had
would not return for the amount we paid
however being foodies we were utterly disappointed with the food
huge portions great and attentive service and pretty good prices
i was highly disappointed by their service and food
i complained to the waiter and then to the manager but the intensity of rudeness from them just went up
the food is great and the milkshakes are even better
stay away if youre claustrophobic
if youre in the hood definitely stop in

this is definitely one of the places that i have continued to come back to over the years

one caveat some of the curried casseroles can be a trifle harsh

the food was almost always excellent
i was pleasently surprised at the taste
a nice space as long as it doesnt get too crowded and a singleminded devotion to its chosen cuisine make mare a great choice for seafood lovers

they really provide a relaxing laidback atmosphere

i stumbled upon this resteraunt on my way home from the subway

the ambience is also more laidback and relaxed
the teas are great and all the sweets are homemade
mojitos and the service are the best part in there
sandwiches burgers and salads like the lemondressed cobb are classic successes
this restaurant is absolutely beautiful
the design is very intimate and romantic
the food was wonderful and imaginative

the worst though was the taste
they were dry stale and pretty flavorless

stay with the roasted chickens and youll be fine
the atmosphere is warm comfortable artsy and sexy
the food is great big selection reasonable prices and the drinks are really good
the steak melted in my mouth
the food did take a few extra minutes to come but the cute waiters jokes and friendliness made up for it
most importantly it is reasonably priced
the selection of food is excellent im not used to having much choice at restaurants and the atmosphere is great
only suggestion is that you skip the dessert it was overpriced and fell short on taste
food was decent but not great
i have no idea why this restaurant is so often overlooked
from the moment you walk in you feel like youre in the perfect place

an excellent choice in midtown

my boyfriend and i went here last night and loved it

and the honey bbq rib tips are yummy
the best chinese food uptown

delish and made to your liking
